meanings.definition: Excessive veneration or reverence for ancestors.
meanings.sent1: The family's filiopietism was evident in the elaborate ancestral shrine they maintained.
meanings.sent2: Many cultures have traditions of filiopietism, showing respect for those who came before.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, Uncle Joe's filiopietism led him to tell stories about great-great-grandparents no one else remembered.
meanings.sent4: Her filiopietism was like a bridge connecting the past to the present, honoring the lineage.
meanings.sent5: The filiopietism of the village was so strong that even the youngest children knew the names of their ancestors.

meanings.definition: The practice of honoring or revering one's ancestors.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, filiopietism involves regular ceremonies to honor ancestors.
meanings.sent2: Filiopietism can be seen in the family photos displayed with pride in the living room.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's filiopietism reached new heights when she started a family tree project that covered an entire wall.
meanings.sent4: The filiopietism of the community was like a warm embrace, connecting everyone through shared heritage.
meanings.sent5: The filiopietism of the town was so strong that even newcomers felt a sense of belonging.

meanings.definition: An excessive devotion to or reverence for one's ancestors.
meanings.sent1: His filiopietism was so intense that he spent hours each day researching his family history.
meanings.sent2: The filiopietism of the elderly woman was evident in the way she spoke of her ancestors with great respect.
meanings.sent3: The family's filiopietism was so strong that they held a yearly memorial service for all their ancestors.
meanings.sent4: Her filiopietism shone through in the way she preserved old family heirlooms with meticulous care.
meanings.sent5: The filiopietism of the village was like a thread weaving through generations, keeping the past alive in the present.
